Gralog-Core-Api-Specification

The main propose of this library is to define the concepts of GrALoG-Structures and GrALoG-Algorithms that can be used, displayed and / or executed by GrALoG.

See:
          Description

Packages
de.hu.gralog.algorithm This package defines all classes needed to implement algorithms in GrALoG.
de.hu.gralog.algorithm.result This package defines all classes needed by GrALoG-Algorithms to return an AlgorithmResult.
de.hu.gralog.algorithm.result.pd This package defines PersistenceDelegates for all classes in de.hu.gralog.algorithm.result.
de.hu.gralog.app This package defines classes that are needed on the application level.
de.hu.gralog.beans This package and it's subpackages define all classes that are needed to implement and use JavaBeans in GrALoG.
de.hu.gralog.beans.event This package defines the Listener- and Listenable-Interfaces used for events of GrALoG-Beans.
de.hu.gralog.beans.propertydescriptor This package defines all PropertyDescriptors that are currently available in GrALoG.
de.hu.gralog.beans.propertyeditor This package defines all PropertyEditors that are currently available in GrALoG.
de.hu.gralog.beans.support This package defines classes that are especially useful to define Structure-Beans in GrALoG.
de.hu.gralog.jgraph.cellview This package defines DefaultVertexRenderer and DefaultEdgeRenderer that are used by GrALoG-Structures to render their vertices and edges.
de.hu.gralog.jgrapht.traverse This package is an extension for org.jgrapht.traverse.
de.hu.gralog.jgrapht.util  
de.hu.gralog.structure This package together with it's subpackages defines all classes needed to define and use structures in GrALoG.
de.hu.gralog.structure.event Provides Listeners and Listenable-classes that are specific to GraLoG-Structures.
de.hu.gralog.structure.pd Defines the PersistenceDelegates needed by GrALoG to store GrALoG-Structures.
de.hu.gralog.structure.support Defines various helper classes that are used by GrALoG-Structures to provide their functionality.
de.hu.gralog.structure.types This package defines the standard GrALoG-Structures.
de.hu.gralog.structure.types.elements This package defines the standard types for elements (vertices and edges) of a GrALoG-Structure.
de.hu.gralog.util  

 

The main propose of this library is to define the concepts of GrALoG-Structures and GrALoG-Algorithms that can be used, displayed and / or executed by GrALoG. The library can also be seen as a starting point for Plugin-Developers that can use these concepts to build their own types of GrALoG-Structures and GrALoG-Algorithms.

Besides giving an introduction to the concepts underlying GrALoG this documentation therefore also tries to provide hints for Plugin-Developers on how to build their own Plugins for GrALoG. Therefore most of the package-, class- or method- (including this overview-) -JavaDoc-comments contain a section called Plugin-Developers, that explains how to use this package, class or method when developing your own Plugin.

Plugin-Developers

A Plugin in GrALoG basically consists of a definition of GrALoG-Structures and GrALoG-Algorithms. To define your own GrALoG-Structure you have to subclass StructureTypeInfo ( please refer to the description of de.hu.gralog.structure on how to do this ). GrALoG-Algorithms are basically classes that implement the Algorithm- interface, please refer to de.hu.gralog.algorithm on how to build your own algorithms.

Every Plugin in GrALoG comes as a Jar-File that must contain a file called plugin.config in its root-directory. The plugin.config tells GrALoG which GrALoG-Structures and -Algorithms are defined by that Plugin and where to lookup the classes that define them.

The plugin.config is an XML-File, that has the following format: 

        <plugin name="PLUGIN_NAME">
                <description>
                        <![CDATA[PLUGIN-DESCRIPTION]]>
                </description>
                <structures>
                        <structure typeInfoClass="TYPE_INFO_CLASS"/>
                </structures>
                <algorithms>
                        <algorithm name="ALGORITH_NAME" class="ALGORITH_CLASS"/>
                </algorithms>
        </plugin>
Here PLUGIN_NAME, PLUGIN-DESCRIPTION, TYPE_INFO_CLASS, ALGORITHM_NAME and ALGORITHM_CLASS, have the following meaning:

Field Meaning
PLUGIN_NAME This is the name for your plugin, that is displayed to the User by GrALoG
PLUGIN_DESCRIPTION The description for this plugin enclosed in a CDATA-Element. Can be an arbitrary HTML-String
TYPE_INFO_CLASS The fully qualified classname for your subclass of StructureTypeInfo, that defines your GrALoG-Structure
ALGORITHM_NAME This is the name for your GrALoG-Algorithm that is displayed to the user by GrALoG
ALGORITHM_CLASS The fully qualified classname for your class implementing Algorithm, that defines your GrALoG-Algorithm.
